website_summaries.verdict: A low-priced fan that is easy to install, if you don't mind a little noise.
pros: Makes a big difference in your attic heat, and the price is low
Owner can tailor the temperature to the local climate
cons: Not as quiet as some other options

customer_reviews.title: This is a good fan. It would get five stars except for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good fan. It would get five stars except for two main things. First, I had to do a bit of work on it to make it quiet, mostly add in some rubber isolation on the brackets. Second, the shroud is not round, it's roundish, so it complicates somewhat the installation. That being said, once I installed it with the isolation, it runs very quietly and does an excellent job of keeping the attic cool. I recommended it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Echo E West

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Our fan had not worked since we moved in several years ago. Installation was simple. Ours is on a switch as well. I left it on the manufacturers recommendation of 90 degrees for the thermostat but may tweak up a bit if it seems to be running too much. Installation took about 30 minutes with my son helping as the gopher and light man. Seems quite powerful as I could feel the draw when he flipped the switch. I could also feel and smell the stale attic air from outside. Quite impressed so far. Should help the air conditioning. Now for another layer of insulation!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so far so good. only installed for about a week
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. only installed for about a week. quieter than I thought it would be. the blades took some bending, out of the package two of the four hit the back brackets, but they are flexible enough. also be mind full of the fasteners provided with the brackets, the heads are big enough that the blades contact them if not way forward or back
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: Very Basic Fan. Loud.
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic prop fan and included temp controller. Was easy enough to install. Hard-wires to your electrical system. I recommend providing a plywood flange with a round hole cut to the diameter of the fan. This is a cheap fan and it gets the job done OK, but is VERY loud. I can a low hum pretty much anywhere in my house. I even mounted mine on rubber grommets. I could probably go back and provide some better vibration isolation. I'm guessing some of the vibration is just an balancing issue due to mediocre build quality. I'm only anticipating this lasting 2-3 years (my experience with similar fans), so I figured not worth the hassle of re-mounting.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: With A Little Fabrication, Good Investment!
customer_reviews.text: You have to do a little modification for this thing to be as efficient as possible. First things first, they sent the wrong size bolts. Oh well... made them work. I mounted this upside down in between two beams using lag bolts and right angle (L Brackets). Also, to reduce noise and vibration I used rubber grommets and washers where I mounted to ply wood. It aligns with an static louvre that’s pushing out some good exhaust now! In Texas heat, ridiculous having static anything on your roof. Air just doesn’t move like science dictates at 100 degrees in your attic.
customer_reviews.author: mrbmg

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Super fast delivery. Well packaged. Fan itself seems ok. Not the best quality. But seems to be doing the work. Not very quiet. But I don’t mind since it’s in the garage. The nuts and blots supplied sucked. The bolts are too big or nuts too small. Very difficult to put them together, plus the base of the bolts are squared which are supposed to fit on the fan housing but they slip out when trying to tightened the nuts. I just drilled new holes and screwed the housing and brackets tighter, way easier... and it’s much more efficient. Thermostat seems to work ok, although it’s hard to say how accurate it is.
customer_reviews.author: Gandalf

customer_reviews.title: CX1500 Ventilator
customer_reviews.text: Opened the box and found the outer fan housing was out of round and fan blades rubbed on one side. I managed to get it reshaped enough for blades to spin and installed it in the wall. Once wired, the fan would not turn on. The thermostat is defective. I wired it around the thermostat and it ran as expected. I ordered a replacement thermostat from Amazon to correct the problem. Considering there was no visual damage to the shipping box, or the product box I assume the out of round issue was a factory defect. Apparently the inoperative thermostat got by QC also. There are other manufactures available, I'd suggest trying one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Charry

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace an older model that quit on us. One of our attics is not vented well and in our SoCal summers the attic was getting extremely hot. The attic is directly above our master closet. We had the soles melt on several pairs of shoes. Our roof was also wearing much faster than on other parts of the house. This fan has fixed the problem. It isn’t super quiet, but most of the noise is related to the quantity of air being moved. The motor itself is pretty quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Piece of cake
customer_reviews.text: Frame has a little flex to it, but that makes it easier to mount actually. It is what it is, a medium duty fan. Simple to wire, simple to install. Had to flip the mounts around to get it to mount in my space, the mount arms were shorter otherwise, but it is made to do that, so it took just a few minutes. Once I had my other fan removed, it took just 15 minutes to mount this one, another 15 to run the wire, nothing unusual or weird in the install. It's just a fan, after all.
customer_reviews.author: Pharmboy

customer_reviews.title: it lowered the temperature of the attic-
customer_reviews.text: It is an attic fan- It worked- and since I was trying to replace it in the old roof hood- I had a slightly hard time- Had to cut out the old one, take down the hood, and place the new motor in. I trimmed the fan blades, and now my house is cooled and not cranking the ac 24-7 I did not want to spend more time searching for hoods that fit(off by 1/4 inch or take the time to whatever- it was a hot day up there. I recommend it since you are searching for cost and effectiveness.
customer_reviews.author: A. Chiriboga

customer_reviews.title: Gable fan
customer_reviews.text: This IS intended to be a permanent installation, hard wired into your home. It is NOT a plug in type. Wiring and installing is simple, but if you are not comfortable doing wiring, hire an electrician to install. This was to replace a very similar fan that died after 8 years of hard summer use. Quiet (for a large fan) moves a lot of air, does a good job. Slip a rubber hose washer under each mounting bolt to help reduce vibration. This was the best price I found.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Childress

customer_reviews.title: It does what it is supposed to so far
customer_reviews.text: I'll start off by saying it works. The temperature control does what it is supposed to and it moves air. Beyond that I am not very impressed, the housing is thin flimsy steel and the electric motor isn't very smooth or free spinning. When you shut it off it barely coasts to a stop, it basically just stops and the motor has a noticeable "whir" to it when running. I can't complain too much, it does work, I just don't have much confidence in it for the long term
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: I had it at least a full season and it runs fine
customer_reviews.text: Not hard to install. I think it was typically on about 5 hours a day in the Summer and is holding up well. I had to play around with the thermostat on it to have it come on at the right temp. I think this thing pays for its self in 2 months. I saw my AC bill really drop. I used a sabre saw to cut a hole for it in a sheet of plywood I screwed against studs in front of a vent. Not hard. Oh, I was lucky there was a wiring connection box nearby. Don't do the electric unless you know what you are doing.
customer_reviews.author: eric Krieg

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and great value.
customer_reviews.text: I am an electrical contractor and I have installed at least a dozen of these. It's a great fan and seems to be very good quality especially for the price. I like the fact that it comes with a thermostat. I have even bought this complete unit and stripped the guts out and put them in a roof-mounted ventilation fan since the motor is the same size and the rotation is the same. I can definitely speak firsthand and say that the cooler your attic is the cooler your home will be and the less your air conditioner will have to run. It's a bit noisy but it sure works well.
customer_reviews.author: Charles M Piscitelli

customer_reviews.title: Buy the recommended add ons from the other reviews
customer_reviews.text: the rubber washers specifically ... installed much like everyone else has mentioned here using a plywood board and cutting out the hole for the fan. The rubber washers definitely help with reducing rattle. Other than that, its a fan, it does fan like things and if it could talk, I am sure it would agree and say it does them well. Connected with a shop cord and plugged into an outlet, letting the thermostat monitor when it turns on and off
customer_reviews.author: Maverick Vailladin

customer_reviews.title: EPIC DESIGN FAIL
customer_reviews.text: The fan blade hits on the head of the mounting bolt because of a penny pinching design. Why not make the shroud a 1//2" larger instead of cheaping out and saving a couple of pennies? Why not use carriage bolts instead of hex head instead of cheaping out and saving a couple of pennies? Designing a fan shroud/mount isn't exactly brain surgery or rocket science ..... This is why Made in America has gotten a bad name
customer_reviews.author: longjohn119

customer_reviews.title: Trash and wasting money. Stopped working after few weeks, so as a replacement I got.
customer_reviews.text: I install this one in spring and fist it worked well, but after several weeks I noticed it doesn't work. Could not return as more than a month passed, checked everything and found out that motor is not working anymore. Sent motor back to manufacturer for replacement paying $18 for postal as they don't cover. Got a replacement motor, installed and it worked for few weeks and today it stopped again. I'm not going to send it back paying another 18 for this trash but will buy something better.
customer_reviews.author: Oleg

customer_reviews.title: Replace the old fan perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Our attic fan died after 15 years. I was thinking to replace the motor. But it was impossible to take the blades off the motor shaft. So I decided to replaced the whole thing including the notor,the blade and the thermostat. This fan is exactly the same as my old one. So the job was done in 30 minutes. Nice and easy. There are videos on YouTube about how to do it. Hope this fan will last another 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: for the money the unit works fine and does exhaust the attic after the blades were ...
customer_reviews.text: Fan works well. I am concerned that I may no be getting maximum output from the fan. Fan was pulling hot air into the attic at first. My options were to turn the complete unit around which would have exposed the motor to the elements or reverse the blades. I reversed the blades. my concern is that a fan blade has a specific pitch. When spinning the opposite way I don't believe that we are getting the CFM as advertised. Another review pointed to the same flaw. The manufacturer should rewire the motor or change the fan blade. That being said; for the money the unit works fine and does exhaust the attic after the blades were reversed.
customer_reviews.author: George Hoos

customer_reviews.title: Well made and quiet running!
customer_reviews.text: I've recently purchased two of the Cool Attic CX1500 Gable Mount Power Attic Ventilator fans and both units were easy to install, and are running very quietly and efficiently to cool both the main and room over garage (ROG) attics in my home. So far, I couldn't be happier with them. Historically, attic fans don't usually last more than a few seasons for me, so we'll see how these do.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Simple and functional
customer_reviews.text: First one was missing hardware and blades were bent. After a quick return and replace through Amazon the new one is in. Easy to install and much quieter than the old one from home improvement store. Used 1/4" lag bolts and rubber washers. The shroud is thin metal and not perfectly round out of the box. With a little finesse it fits nicely into the opening. My attic seems cooler. 4 stars and praying it lasts well beyond the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: VAHusker

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Mounted this fan to a framework that attached to the gable vent. Moved thermostat farther away than stock cable alloted for. Also added in a manual-on option, via a wireless key-fob relay. The power for manual-on attaches to the post-thermostat wire. Actually, I just put the relay/thermostat output into a receptical, which I then plug the fan into. That way, if we clean the screen, etc, I can just unplug the fan, unmount it, and move it away, without undoing the wiring.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jones

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like a helicopter
customer_reviews.text: I’m writing this review from across my driveway, where it sounds like the air cavalry is approaching. I’m not talking about a light hum, more like the “chop, chop, chop” of an attack helicopter. Yes, this fan moves lots of air, and yes, the thermostatic control works well. But I really can’t recommend it due to the excessive fan blade noise.
customer_reviews.author: Random1234

customer_reviews.title: I REPLACED THE OLD MOTOR WITH THIS ONE
customer_reviews.text: I installed it about a month ago and so far so good. My old attic fan motor went bad so I replaced it with this one, I removed the "circular" casing and only used the motor with the fan and the thermostat (cheaper than just buying the motor. It took me approx 30 minutes since I had to deal with electricity (not a pro) but I was able to do it!
customer_reviews.author: Hugo B. Aldana

customer_reviews.title: To lower attic temperature, this is a good choice
customer_reviews.text: I live in the torrid south and an exhaust fan in the attic is a requirement. This was a replacement for another put in last year, but as much as they have to run, I am not surprised. We have it set to cut on at 99 degrees, so it runs all day and some of the night. That way our AC unit upstairs does not have to run constantly.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mulkey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hook up
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it actually made a difference to my electric bill this summer, but it was easy to hookup and works well. Pretty straight forward. I mounted a box and receptacle in the attic and wired up a plug to the fan so I can just unplug it during winter months and remove it since mine is mounted in front of a small window.
customer_reviews.author: G D.

customer_reviews.title: No problems ... Nothing wrong with it
customer_reviews.text: Working well so far .. In the hot summer ... My attic is very hot .. It's running all day off at night for a week now .. No problems I added a manual switch and actually moved the thermostats down in my garage Well, 160 degrees in the attic mean 100 in the garage so I make it start at 90 It's working fine Look at the picture ... You may like the idea .. Just make the wire longer and put the box anywhere 😜😜
customer_reviews.author: Taha Mohamed

customer_reviews.title: Failed in under two months...
customer_reviews.text: The fan failed after two months... probably ran 12 days total. Return, which I just started, is not easy... I have to pay to ship it back for repair, and just send back the parts I know don't work (I checked the motor which is not working, but am not sure if the thermostat works), what do people do that don't know how to test machines? The cust svc rep was nice, but this seems more complicated, and expensive, than it should be.
customer_reviews.author: joseph d

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for replacement parts
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be working well. After being told it would work in my attic I found that it would not due to the gable covers/vents. No matter, I had an existing fan in the roof that I hadn't noticed before (never looked) and it wasn't working anymore as it was original to the house. Took the motor and thermostat from this fan and put the old fan blade on and reinstalled into the roof. I wonder how much this will do to keep the attic cooler but I guess it's better than nothing. Wish I could add them on each end at the gables.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Order more than you need. Some can be defective.
customer_reviews.text: This model generally does not sell in-store (Home Depot, Lowes, etc). Better to order more than you need and return what you don't use. One fan did not turn on at all and we still had to pay for full day labor. I hope they increase their QC. I'll follow up after the summer if these fans hold up.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Fire hazard
customer_reviews.text: Pros: it is very quiet. Cons: I referenced the thermostat, and it is off by about 15 degrees. The major problem is with the assembly being a fire hazard. The ground almost touched the hot wire on the thermostat. I had to add shrink tubing and tape to feel comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: totaljim

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I liked the installation video. Would give it a 5 starts if the I didn't need to bend the fan blades a bit because it was actually hitting the wood mounting beam. However, it does help with the air flow and cool down the attic. I did recommend it to my other friend.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Wood

customer_reviews.title: Read the Directions and order the rubber washers
customer_reviews.text: We installed this ourselves and followed other recommendations to make sure we read the directions for install and using the rubber washers to cut down on noise, works well and was the lowest cost option. Only giving 4 stars because the seller should start including the washers :)
customer_reviews.author: racer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for 6 + years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this attic fan in April of 2012. Tonight the fan started making a pretty loud sound as though the blades were hitting the housing. As it turns out the motor has gone bad. Where I live the summers are pretty hot so this fan has worked for many hours, every day from May to October. I feel like I got my $50-60 worth. Will be ordering another.
customer_reviews.author: Jim D

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: This product reached my expectations. I used both these units to replace the failed motors in my roof vents. No significant problems with the install and for the money spent, if they turn out to be reliable I will continue to be a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Butler

customer_reviews.title: great, but needs work on quality contol
customer_reviews.text: works great! only complaint is the lining of the trim.....tin has groves in it- line them up before riveting! if they're not lined up, they'll rub, which will clink clink clink......id show a picture but it's already installed and im out of the attic. other than that....installed today- hotter than a son of gun in the attic here in TEXAS and fired right up when plugged in. CHECK QUALITY CONTROL ON NEXT BATCHES THAT GOES OUT! it would have been a homer had it not been for the poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Phi221

customer_reviews.title: 1 YEAR 1 MONTH NOW DEAD!!
customer_reviews.text: Did not last for my money worth. no info on how to get the 2-year warranty policy. going to the big box store to buy a new one at least if it fails I know where to take to get a replacement. it's noisy with vibration during operation.
customer_reviews.author: SJV

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself some frustration
customer_reviews.text: I read a number of reviews, some commenting on the quality. The fan housing is fine, the problem is the cheap motor. After running for less than a day the motor is already squeaking like the bearings are going bad. I was warned by the other reviews. Just sharing to save others frustration. It's not fun to install... And less to do it twice since this unit is poorly designed with the cheapest motor possible
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and effective
customer_reviews.text: I used my attic ventilators in my woodshop to ensure fresh air is cycled through. One on each end of the shop (intake and exhaust) provides a simple and very effective air supply. Beats having fans sitting on the floor or hanging from the ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel V.

customer_reviews.title: Tempreture control not working.
customer_reviews.text: Installed the fan a week ago. Apparently, the fan ran as expected. However, the tempreture control. ie thermostat is not functional. The start/stop function does not work. I tried to call support with the number shown on the Amazon page. Unfortunately, it is not a working number. Don't know what to do.
customer_reviews.author: Mequ

customer_reviews.title: This was a great budget fan for my small single story home.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great budget fan for my small single story home. I recently started storing things in my attic which is quite small. My house is 999sq feet so this was just right. Installation was a snap and the thermostat works as it should. I already had an outlet in my attic so I merely used a donor extension cord which I wired to the fan. It's really not that loud and hard to notice when running (slight hum if you really try to listen for it). If you need help installing it, just go on youtube and there are a few good videos there.
customer_reviews.author: Ano

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT; COOLER ATTIC!
customer_reviews.text: Runs quietly and helps clear hot air from attic. Temp sensor activates usage; automatic control. Bought two for my home and loved them (run smoothly for 24-mo; buying new one for my in-laws to help them save on electricity bill (reduces A/C usage by keeping attic cooler). Set it amd forget it. This is the best value at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Octavio-CALIF

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Good fan for the money. If you're somewhat handy and have e few tools shouldn't be too bad to install. There are some good videos online to help get you started. We installed two fans in our application and they function well.
customer_reviews.author: John Aamodt

customer_reviews.title: Thermostat works backwards on 2/2 units for 2 days now
customer_reviews.text: For the price they are very similar to what I had before. Need to call help line though. I’m in FL and the fan comes on at 80 and as you lower setting and goes off at 80 when you raise the setting.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable mistake
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe the manufacturer made such a simple mistake that made the installation a pain. The nuts and bolts to mount the brackets are threaded differently. Seriously, ALL of them. I had to put each bolt in a vice and re-thread them. You can't just use standard hex bolts because they are panheads so the blades won't make contact. Anyway, once I mounted the brackets the fan works fine. One good comment - this 14", 1200 cfm was a good replacement for the old 16", 900 cfm.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: great attic fan
customer_reviews.text: We bought this a few years ago and this was the first summer we had it installed in the attic. Very happy with the function, as it moved enough air for our 1500sq ft house to greatly drop the temperature in the attic on hot summer days. Wish I would have bought one sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Parks

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, but the metal is REALLY thin
customer_reviews.text: This fan works well, it moves air powerfully and as it should and is very affordable for what it does. Installing it was pretty easy, however the metal shrouding is so thin and flexible I found it had to be mounted PERFECTLY with some pushing and pulling to get the shroud in-round. Otherwise the blades would scrape the edge. This problem was amplified by the screws that hold the brackets sticking out. The clearance is incredibly tight, and if it's not absolutely perfect the blades will scrape or jam on the screw heads. Hopefully the quality will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Justin V.

customer_reviews.title: Thermostat failure
customer_reviews.text: The thermostat only worked properly for two weeks. Now, the thermostat does not shut off the fan when the temperature falls below the set point of 95oF, which was determined using a temperature gun. Touching the setting dial lightly with a screwdriver will turn the fan off until the next day. When the temperature exceeds the set point, the fan runs but does not turn off when the temperature falls below the set point. I purchased the gable fan because of the number of very positive reviews. I would like a replacement thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Quiet inside the shed. Not real quiet outside the shed but I like to know the fan is on, so that's a good thing. Turns on at a certain temp and keeps the attic a lot cooler in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: nbonafede

customer_reviews.title: thermostatic controller is off
customer_reviews.text: I agree with the other reviewers here, the thermostatic controller is off. I have other fan gable but equipped with fire-stat thermostat switch and this turns ON (and OFF as well) 2 hours late compared to the other one. I ended replacing the controller.
customer_reviews.author: fred

customer_reviews.title: Thermostat not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: The Thermostat is highly unreliable. Can't seem to get it to turn on or off without tapping on the thermostat housing with my finger. Sometimes will keep running throughout the night non stop yet the ambient temperature is lower than the "on" setting on the thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: Don Ramon Mamajuana

customer_reviews.title: Good fan
customer_reviews.text: Mounting wasn't difficult , hard wired in. Moves a lot of air. Noise level is acceptable. Mine is over garage so not an issue. Works better than plastic framed one it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Jack T. Slater Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Typical attic fan, will last a year or so , then the bushings will fail.
customer_reviews.text: They are all made with crap bushings that wear out in a season, but you have to have it, so you replace, replace, replace! We once produced things that lasted in America, now, not so much. Would it be so hard to install sealed roller bearings? Really?
customer_reviews.author: dragonmyfeet

customer_reviews.title: Price for product
customer_reviews.text: I like the ease of install, I put this in my attic space, my house is a 1600 sq ft rambler with 5/12 pitch trusses it seems to help keep house cooler by about 5-7 degrees on a sunny day
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A Palmer

customer_reviews.title: easy installation. Im in the process of selling my ...
customer_reviews.text: easy installation. Im in the process of selling my house and 2 out of 3 fans went out. So I purchased these and the instalation was easy for me. I did have to retro fit it since the existin fan is attached to the sloped roof and was able to just remove the motor and blades and attach it to the existing round metal. definately recommend this item. the price is great and it came in two days.
customer_reviews.author: Jose L. Chavez

customer_reviews.title: attic fan
customer_reviews.text: It works but it is off balance it vibrates in excess and it is noisy, the air propellers one blade seems longer thus the reason to vibrate, i have a feeling it won't last very long, tell me what do you intend to do about it ?
customer_reviews.author: Mannel G.

customer_reviews.title: TOOOOO Noisy
customer_reviews.text: It is effective & does move a lot of air but way tooo noisy For the first few days it was quiet. then the noise started increasing,too much noise and a constant humm. I tried rubber washers, adjusting the position, isolating it from the frame of the house, but the noise seems to be only getting worst. it seems to be unbalanced and vibrates when spinning.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H.

customer_reviews.title: No hardware included but operates as described
customer_reviews.text: The instructions stated use included hardware but unfortunately there was none included. Finding suitable hardware that would not catch on fan blades too some effort. Once that was remedied the installation was ok. A bit of craftsmanship but can be accomplish with remedial skills. It can be heard in the attic but not too bad. Definitely use rubber washers to reduce the vibration
customer_reviews.author: Laura Susana

customer_reviews.title: Performs as expected
customer_reviews.text: Received earlier than expected in excellent condition, easy to install, did all the prep work on the bench, mounting it on a 3/8 plywood board. Initially connected the power with an old extension cord, will later connect with romex. Adjusted the temperature set point after mounting on the gable.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Ran for about 120 hot days & it’s DEAD,
customer_reviews.text: Installed Late May 2019 and came home today July 22 2020 and it is RATTLING THE HOUSE, Bearings clearly shot! Made the one year warranty though!!!???!!!
customer_reviews.author: blh

customer_reviews.title: Some MacGyver work is needed.
customer_reviews.text: The fan mounting brackets were easy to install. I used loctite on those screws. The thermostat was missing the wire retainer. The picture here is from the old thermostat. So I reused the retainer. To cushion from fan vibration I used pieces of a computer keyboard wrist pad. I also used the old mounting brackets witht their small round holes as washers. The new mounting brackets had large slits instead of round screw holes. So my screws would fit without the modification. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Martin

customer_reviews.title: the fan works fine but the thermostat is defective
customer_reviews.text: Well, the fan works fine but the thermostat is defective. I can bypass the thermostat and the fan runs fine. Wire through the thermostat and the fan will not run. Temperature is not the issue, must be 135' in the attic and the fan will not turn on via the thermostat regardless of setting. Dont want to return the whole unit when just the thermostat is bad, especially since it is already installed. Guess I will just run constant bypassing the thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: John Flannagan

customer_reviews.title: Great fan and temp control
customer_reviews.text: Great product and awesome air flow. The only complaint I have is the bolts that attach to the mounting brackets do not stay put when tightening the nut (even though there are square shaped bolt stays on the edges of the shroud).
customer_reviews.author: A &C

customer_reviews.title: So its a pretty easy job to do
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace the one in our attic that had went out. we live in the south and summers here are well, summer in the south. I noticed are air was not feeling right and seemed to never cut off. When this came in the mail, my husband replaced it by himself. So its a pretty easy job to do. I was able to tell a difference right away. Our house stays cooler now and the air isnt always running. We have had no issues with it not working properly. It does what it is suppose to.
customer_reviews.author: Candie Russell

customer_reviews.title: Quit after less than 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Installed in Feb, tested, all was good. Turned on in March, no good, fan is bad and is getting proper voltage. Contacted manufacture and they will not send return authorization after 4 email and phone call attempts. Total waist of money and warranty is a joke. They don't stand behind their own products.
customer_reviews.author: bhrdman

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: Much better price than retail + Free shipping. Correct installation of fan will prevent any issues regarding the inability of the blades to spin without hitting the bolt heads. You have to make sure to make the brackets pull tightly away from the center of the fan to keep it in shape. Other than that, easy installation. Make sure to insulate around the fan to keep air moving the right direction. my gable is a few inches shorter than the fan, and the fan blows air up against the wall and back into the attic, so insulation was required. All in all, good buy, not too noisy -- time will tell the quality and i'll update the review if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph E. Repasky

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit !!!
customer_reviews.text: It was a perfect fit and installed in 25 minutes. Works great.....I just got it in at the end of Summer, so I'm ready for next year !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FAN works well
customer_reviews.text: No problems with the fan so far. However, I installed this to cool my attic space instead of trying more expensive measures. Didn't work for that as the attic is about the same high temp as when I started. I have soffit vents but no ridge vent. Guess I'll bite the bullet and install a ridge vent and add more insulation.
customer_reviews.author: Sarge

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend that you also purchase Danco 88578 rubber flat washers
customer_reviews.text: This fan is installed and working. It is quiet and so far efficient. I would recommend that you also purchase Danco 88578 rubber flat washers, or something similar as "shock mounts" to limit the transmission of vibration to the house and it's associated noise. The fan lost 1 star because I had to adjust the blades on the shaft to prevent them from hitting the cross members on the shroud. After this adjustment, this installation went as well as possible in a 130F degree attic. I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Good value for basic workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work fine, pumps out lots of hot air from the attic on hot days. Can hear it from the bedroom below, but not annoying.
customer_reviews.author: GrassValleyMe

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Installation was easy!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the item. We needed just the motor, but apparently the only way to purchase that was to buy the entire unit. The price for this was comparable to purchasing just the motor at a local store, so we were able to use just the parts we needed from this unit. SO FAR IT HAS BEEN WORKING GREAT! I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: DaniDawnW

customer_reviews.title: Easy modification makes this a nice unit
customer_reviews.text: Other than the bolts for the mounting legs being too tall, the fan is quiet and runs smooth. Simply replace the factory bolts with standard 1/4" bolts and this fan is a good unit at a very reasonable price. I'd give it 5 stars if the factorr had used standard bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fan
customer_reviews.text: its a little quieter than I expected in person. Can't hear the fan itself through a piece of drywall but make sure to use rubber standoffs if you dont want to hear the rest of the house vibrating when its running. And thats the loud part.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: 5” diameter motor fit perfectly in the quad old bracket
customer_reviews.text: Fit Perfect. 5” diameter motor fit inside the old 4-bracket mount. (New motor bracket had a tripod bracket would have required removal of the old shroud, which would have been very difficult.). Didn’t have to drill any new holes. Same amperage as the old motor. But 1300 CFM instead of 900 with the old fan.
customer_reviews.author: Rriles

customer_reviews.title: Fit well into the small opening space I had, good volume of air.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to blow air into one end of the attic, another larger fan on exit end. works well. keeps the temp down 20-30 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: James N. Woody

customer_reviews.title: It is effective in getting the heat out of my ...
customer_reviews.text: It is effective in getting the heat out of my attic. However it seems to be unbalanced and vibrates when spinning. It takes me one hour to put it on so I am not going to return it. Maybe that's what you get for that price. I wouldn't put it anywhere that people has chance to touch. In my case it is far inside roof-top attic where nobody goes.
customer_reviews.author: XG Feng

customer_reviews.title: Chinese garbage
customer_reviews.text: Quit working after 1 season. Would make nice wall art / door stop / boat anchor but not even close as a reliable attic fan. Just 1 more piece of Chinese garbage flooding good ole USA.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bonnett

customer_reviews.title: Motor seized up after one season. Not a quality motor
customer_reviews.text: This was a drop in replacement for an old attic from around 2000. The fan blade design seems to work better than the old one and so far this thing is whisper quiet. I don't hear a thing when its running. After only one season of use the motor has seized up. My previous fan lasted over 15 years. Not recommended
customer_reviews.author: C0untDeM0net

customer_reviews.title: Fan appears to run like it should
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in my attic about two months ago. It replaced a broken attic fan. Installation was no exactly easy, but I didn't have any major problems either. It has run several hours every day in our hot Alabama summer. Vibration is minimal. It appears to move air like it needs to.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Works great in my storage building
customer_reviews.text: I recently rebuilt my storage building and purchased a chest freezer to put out there. I was concerned with the high summer heat/humidity straining the chest freezer and this fan was the answer to help by automatically starting (when it gets too warm) and pulling out some of the heat.
customer_reviews.author: zoltar_speaks

customer_reviews.title: Gable fan that works
customer_reviews.text: After reviewing other comments I purchased this fan for my 1600 sq. ft. attic. Live in PA, july temps in attic above 120 degrees F. Installed this fan this morning 6am-8am, 1 man job except needed help with wiring electric. see my pictures for additional comments. I am satisfied with the purchase, I would like to see a better design for the housing and supplied bolts. Fan is still running with little noise, can hear it when outside next to the house but no vibrations or loud noises as others reported. Make sure you secure the fan to studs and ply or paneling as suggested in the destructions. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Rb

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Received item very quickly. Installation is simple, electrical hookup is very straightforward. I installed a switch in the garage to shut off if and when it needs repair. I does make some noise, in my case it is above a garage at end of house. We don't hear it in the family room or kitchen. Bdrms are at other end of house so no noise there either. Hey it's a fan, they do make noise. Had our first heat wave and it really did make a difference! The motor is a lomanco brand, we have had one at work for a vent in a compressor room, it's worked fine for over 5 years. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RNA

customer_reviews.title: a real P.O.S. bying is a mistake!!!
customer_reviews.text: A waste of money, bought on June 21, got here the first of July installed about a week later, and stopped last week , check the thermo and bypassed straight to motor nothing work, a real P.O.S., if you want to waste your hard earned money, well a great place to do it, I recommend you not buy this fan!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Even though I am in construction, I've never worked with attic fans, or Gable fans before... With that said, I was able to mount it, wire it, the instructions were clear on how to wire the thermostat, which works fine, contrary to other people's reviews. I have no complaints regarding the fan.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Koch

customer_reviews.title: Cool Attic Fan CX1500
customer_reviews.text: I will see how long it last. It does work ok for a cheap fan. Costs me $47 on amazon, shipped free. Watch the price. Price was going up and down every hour or so. I clicked on to buy as soon as i seen a low price to my liking. It says made in USA, but it does not tell you the motor is made in China. It is a sealed cheaply made motor that you cannot oil. It has no ball bearings like a better quality motor. Should last a few years. Giving it 3 stars is really pushing it. I do understand you usually get what you pay for. Cheap is cheap.
customer_reviews.author: wiseman

customer_reviews.title: Works well and as expected
customer_reviews.text: No more ridiculously hot attic perfect works as expected and reduces the heat in that upstairs confined space.
customer_reviews.author: justMeLat

customer_reviews.title: Missing an L-Bracket
customer_reviews.text: I need the company to ship me an L-Bracket it was missing one vibrates without it. The product works fine make sure you isolate with rubber. It is strong and draws 2.5 Amps, should have gotten a smaller one, for less amperage. Very good product other than missing l-bracket
customer_reviews.author: T-Way

customer_reviews.title: Can't contact seller!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fan was great. Thermostat was horrible! Didn't work right out the box!!! Had to bypass thermostat till new one came in. Can't contact seller. Phone number doesn't work. SMH!!! Would not buy again!
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Quieter than I'd expected. Using this as an exhaust fan in my shop for when I'm welding or torching something. Moves a lot of air, can clean out my 30 X 40 shop in about 15 minutes. Very low power draw, less than an amp. I'm not using the thermostat control switch that came with it, but I did test it and it works fine. Nice that it comes with it if you were going to use this for it's true intended purpose. Metal fan blade, white motor, adjustable mounting brackets. Appears to be mostly galvanized steel for the surround and brackets. Probably aluminum for the blades.
customer_reviews.author: canoer79

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, the search continues.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and install, my only issue is the unit creates a lot of noise and vibration. Enough to be heard in 3 rooms of the house even with a plywood cover to help secure it to wall. Would have been great if it wasn’t so loud.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: fan did not last long
customer_reviews.text: This fan stopped working less than a year after I bought it. It first started making a loud humming sound for a few days until we had to disconnect it because we could not sleep at night due to the noise. It was easy to install but I thought I'd get at least a couple of years worth of function out of it. Disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Amazon is getting worse,,, be careful buying
customer_reviews.text: If it wasn't such a hassle to pack and send back this junk ...the thermostat was used wtf and the fan is cheap as they come
customer_reviews.author: Buy local, buy your grow stuff from US

customer_reviews.title: good gable addition folks / update 7/16/19
customer_reviews.text: does the job it says it does. Very pleased / up date \ Purchased last September , raised price 17.52 since . now not better price than h.d. , 1600 cfm. for only 2.35 more better value , this is why i don't like giving reviews
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: Affordable & quiet enough
customer_reviews.text: . I liked that the controller isn’t part of the fan housing and can be mounted away from the air stream just wish it could go a little further but I was able to mount it higher so it sits in hotter air
customer_reviews.author: HILL BILLY

customer_reviews.title: Big help, much more comfortable inside and good price.
customer_reviews.text: Easily installed and it makes a huge difference in our non-air conditioned home. We set the thermostat to 85 degrees and ignore it after that. It comes on when necessary and shuts off when its not. Some reviews say it is loud but we haven't found it so. It moves a lot of air.
customer_reviews.author: Walker D. West

customer_reviews.title: Install it correctly but just the fan is not enough
customer_reviews.text: Install was easy enough and it works like it is supposed to. I would add two things to it. First, make sure you set the temp high enough or it will run day and night. Second, if you are concerned enough to install this, also consider installing attic foil to reflect the heat back out of your attic. I will not advertise for anyone so Google attic foil or reflective material. The foil cooled my attic and this fan takes care of the rest. Next week, after I add a walking platform in the trusses, I am adding 9" more of insulation to complete the project
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Remove the dome first. Then it will only be a one-person job.
customer_reviews.text: Design was identical to the decades-old one I was replacing. Didn’t need the piece of duct it was mounted to though. So I simply removed the fan from it and mounted it to the existing piece of duct going through the roof. Hardest part of the job was removing the old rusted-out nuts and bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Randall E. Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Cool your attic and save on airconditioning
customer_reviews.text: This product was a direct fit replacement for the old fan in my attic that was 32 years old. It was easy to install, and it works great. I recommend this product to anyone looking to cool their attic and reduce the use of your air conditioner.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Temp control doesn’t work for beans
customer_reviews.text: Temp control doesn’t work for berms. I was replacing and old one that temp control worked awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: a cool attic make for a cool house
customer_reviews.text: Easy install, very good instructions including multiple types of installations. Had struggled with not being able to keep upstairs cool at night without freezing the down stairs, Installing the fan in the gable vent has completely resolved the problem. thermostat is accurate and Fan make about as much noise as a box fan on medium speed, With the Fan unit mounted in attic right above the bedroom noise is almost non existent.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.Top Contributor: Photography

product_meta.title: Cool Attic CX1500 Gable Mount Power Attic Ventilator with 2.6-Amp 60-Hz Motor and 14-Inch Blade
product_meta.description:
Size Name:14-Inch BladeThe Cool Attic standard-duty Attic Exhaust Ventilator offers effective power attic ventilation to reduce heat buildup, equalize temperatures inside and outside the attic, help prevent weather-induced home deterioration, and make living areas more comfortable - all while helping reduce the operating cost of air conditioning. Easy to install with no holes in roof. U.S.A. Fan Diameter in. 14, Air Delivery CFM 1,300, Needs to be Hardwired Yes, Speeds qty. 1, Volts 120, Amps 2.6, Dimensions L x H in. 15 x 15, Depth in. 7. Galvanized steel construction Suitable for 1850 sq. ft. attic Includes 10 Amp adjustable thermostat Requires minimum 600 sq. in. net free air intake vent area Easy installation behind static gable louvers sold separately

AMAZON.COM
Keep your attic cool and ventilated with the power gable ventilator fan. It cools attics up to 1,850 square feet using a 14-inch fan with a 1300 CFM rating. The fan has an adjustable automatic thermostat and prolongs the life of composite roof shingles with lower summer attic temperatures.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Ventamatic CX1500 power gable ventilator fan is a 1,300 CFM power attic roof-mount ventilator with a 2.6-amp motor and steel flange. It has an adjustable automatic thermostat. It works best for attics up to 1,850 square feet. It prolongs the life of composite roof shingles with lower summer attic temperatures. Ventamatic has provided the ventilation industry with an air of excellence for over 60 years. The factory is 100 percent powered by wind generated power, 95 percent of all waste products are recycled, and the packaging is recycled cardboard.

See more
feature_bullets: VENTILATOR FAN: This is a 1300 CFM Power Attic Gable Mount Ventilator with a 2.6 Amp thermally protected motor, a galvanized steel flange, and an automatic thermostat.

ATTIC FAN: The Cool Attic Gable-Mount Attic Ventilator Fan offers effective power attic ventilation to reduce heat buildup, equalize temperatures inside and outside the attic. It has 14-inch fan with 600-square-inch intake. It is galvanized steel construction.

EASY INSTALLATION: It cools attic up to 1,850 square feet and 3.4-amp, 115-volt, 60-Hz thermally protected motor, 1,300 CFM rating at 0.03 static pressure when used with model No. CX2121 automatic shutter. It helps keep your home cooler and reduce utility costs.

HOME ROOF COOLING FAN: This fan helps prevent weather-induced home deterioration and make living areas more comfortable - all while helping reduce the operating cost of air conditioning. Easy to install with no holes in roof required.

GABLE MOUNT FAN: It mounts easily in the gable of your home, behind existing louvers or any other gable louvers of your choice. It will provide ventilation without modifying your roofline, or where roof-mounting is impractical.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,244 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
